actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to clause 13 of Rule I. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:30 a.m. on April 17, 2025.

actions-list.header: Congressional-Executive Commission on the People's Republic of China
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 6913, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Congressional-Executive Commission on the People's Republic of China: Ms. Stefanik and Mr. Nunn of Iowa.

actions-list.header: Board of Trustees of the Harry S. Truman Scholarship Foundation
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 20 U.S.C. 2004(b), and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the Board of Trustees of the Harry S. Truman Scholarship Foundation: Ms. Stefanik.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on April 10, 2025, at 3:36 p.m.: That the Senate passed H.J. Res. 20. Appointments: Senate National Security Working Group- 119th Congress and United States- China Economic and Security Review Commission.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to clause 13 of Rule I, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Monsignor Stephen J. Rossetti, Catholic University of America, Washington DC
The Speaker designated the Honorable Robert J. Wittman to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
